intro: Macrocarpaea lacrossiformis, commonly known as the lacrossiform macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
